tspan.tspan: Mortal Draw
Your blade hungers. Blood is the only thing that can sate it.
Once drawn it demands it, and will punish you for failing.

text.tspan: Your first attack in combat always deals max
damage assuming the attack hits.
If you miss, your opponent may attack you.
This can be defended against at +2DR.
AGI +1 STR +1
Feats d66
You do not have any Omens. And no Omens can
be spent to influence your roll. Instead you
always roll 2d20 for your tests and pick the
highest result.
However, you still Fumble if either of them
come up as 1. Your luck has to run out
eventually.
HP +3, WIL +1
Succeeding a DR12 Strength test allows you to
grapple an unaware foe and automatically Crit
with a one handed bladed weapon.
You may cast Powers with medium
armour and Light zweihand weapons.
Taking this feat a second time to also include
Heavy armour and Heavy zweihand weapons.
You may scry and see the future with an animal’s
innards. Gain an Omen for every 10 hp the beast
had, but never more than your maximum omens.
Usable once per animal kind. The beasts’ innards
may also provide enlightening information.
Add opponent's armour dice to damage
when using blunt weapons.
Form a blood pact with a creature. You can
communicate by thought no matter the distance,
this never goes away. Whatever one experiences,
so does the other. This includes Injury and Death.
Test DR12 Strength to disarm someone with your axe,
warpick, polearm or scythe.
DR16 to use this instead of a defense test.
Attacking the environment doesn't damage your weapon.
Your blood when spilled travels towards the
nearest Impure, Unclean, or Heavily Wounded
creature.
Eating the Fresh Heart of an Unclean creature
restores your Power, up to 4+Will max.
You cannot regain Power by resting.

tspan.tspan: When landing an attack that kills a creature you
must
move and attack another (this includes
allies),
adding
d6 damage
for every creature slain.
Your onslaught stops when you fail to kill and you
fall to the ground exhausted,
losing
your next turn.

text.tspan: You can craft equipment of strangely high
quality using a number of Humanoid corpses:
d6 weapon, 1 corpse worth of bones.
shield, 4 corpses worth of bones.
Light armour, 8 corpses worth.
Defence is DR8 Toughness,
success reduces damage by d4.
Twice per combat when making a ranged or
melee attack, you may reroll the damage
dealt and keep the higher result.
Near perfect vision in darkness,
but the light of the sun burns your eyes.

tspan.tspan: −2DR Presence
when in darkness,
+2DR Presence
when in daylight

text.tspan: Staring into the eyes of a creature
let’s you feel whatever it is feeling.
Spend an Omen to automatically succeed an
attack with a Gun against an unaware enemy.
Crits give you an Omen; Taking damage removes
one, reducing the damage taken by d2.
Consume an Omen and spend a few moments in quiet
meditation. Ask the Game Master a question
pertaining to the current situation.
You will be granted a bizarre vision that provides
enlightening information. GM rolls a d4 in secret,
on a 1 the vision is Deceptive.
Once per combat you may sacrifice your next turn
to interrupt an Enemy's action.
DR12 Agility to Stop their turn, Attack them, or do
something else right before they do.
Improvised and Broken weapons deal d6 damage,
but they are Destroyed after one hit.
You may consume Rotting, Putrid Flesh with a
DR6 Toughness test. Others witnessing this may
find it disgusting. Outcasts roll Morale.
STR +3

tspan.tspan: Armour Cruncher
The plates that were meant to protect them...
they shall be molded to your liking.

text.tspan: STR +0

tspan.tspan: Assassin's Deathblow
A firm grip. A sharp knife. That’s all it takes for someone to disappear
into the alleys of Galgenbeck. You’ve become adept at it over the years.
Axe Warden
The angle of the weapon and the weight of the
strike engraved discipline into your muscles.

text.tspan: AGI +1, STR +1

tspan.tspan: Baned hunter
May it be a curse through your bloodline? Fate?
There is only one certainty held within your mind...
Impurity is a disease that must be purged from this world.

text.tspan: -1 STR, +1 WILL

tspan.tspan: Battle-hardened Deathspeaker
You were called to battle, not for your prowess with blade and shield.
Not for your speed and might.
But because the words you spoke brought death to your enemies.

text.tspan: WIL +1

tspan.tspan: Beastly Scholar
You study the beasts of the land.
Gutting them and spilling viscera to uncover secrets of the world.

text.tspan: PRE +1, WIL +1
21 Blood Pact
It’s a cruel world to be all alone in.
But you’ve found a way to avoid this fate.
WIL +0
22 Bloodthirsty Rage
The rush of combat is addictive.
You’re always chasing that high.
It’s kill or be killed. You can’t stop to ask questions.
STR +1
23 Bone Crafter
You don’t believe in letting things go to waste.
PRE +1, WIL -1

tspan.tspan: Bulwark
The grit of war is something that should be relished.
You prefer using the more direct approach.

text.tspan: STR +1, TOU +2
25 Calm Killer
The knife or arrow that is most careful is the deadliest.
You have a sharp eye for gaps and kinks in armour.
AGI +2

tspan.tspan: Cats Eyes
You looked up at the birds for a sign. Scattered bones, spilled entrails.
For naught.
But one day you saw your fate in the eyes of a cat lurking in the shadows.

text.tspan: PRE +2

tspan.tspan: Culveriner
Through undisturbed breath your hands remain steady,
with blazing rods of iron to ignite your path.

text.tspan: AGI -0, PRE +1

tspan.tspan: Fateful Visions
The fates steer your journey across the dying world.
One can only hope they guide you to redemption and not destruction.

text.tspan: PRE -0, WIL +0

tspan.tspan: First Strike
You believe that the Shimmering Fields are for those
who leap into battle, those who are first to reap glory.

text.tspan: AGI +2
Whether your side passes or fails the initiative roll,
you may Always act First.
Your First action in combat has -2DR.

tspan.tspan: Gutsy Strike
You once saw a man decapitate a horse with a giant sword. It was
less a sword and more a large slab of iron. You can’t help but think
of the beast’s vacant eyes whenever you swing your own sword.

text.tspan: When wielding Zweihand weapons,
you swing with +4DR. If the attack
lands you add d6 to your damage.
STR +3
PRE +1

tspan.tspan: Hyper Awareness
You are paranoid. Seeing danger in every shadow.
Everything wants to kill you. You are jittery with bird-like movements.

text.tspan: PRE +1, AGI +1
You can never be the victim of a Surprise Attack,
and your side takes the initiative on a 3+.
Roll 3d6 for Morale and choose the two lowest dice.

tspan.tspan: Immortal Memory
You are haunted by the memories of those that have fallen. Even if their spirits
have moved on, and the bodies are dust, their memories linger for eternity.

text.tspan: WIL +1
Once per day you may scrounge to find the necessary
herbs and flora to create an infection curing
elixir that also heals d4 HP.
GM rolls a d4, on 1 you create a Toxin dealing d4
damage. DR14 Presence to notice it's a poison.

tspan.tspan: Herbalist Healer
You’ve spent what seemed like an eternity under the haze filled apprenticeship of
a herbalist master. You left with a new outlook on life, and a few extra skills.
Harbinger of Misery
You feel a dark blessing course though your veins.
You have dedicated yourself to the black disk which will block out the sun.

text.tspan: Gain 4 Maximum Omens instead of 2.
As long as you live the GM rolls
Two misery dice every day.
All -0

tspan.tspan: Interrupter
You have tingling impulses that act before you do,
you've managed to survive because of it.

text.tspan: AGI +2
44 Intimidating
Lifeless eyes that breed unease will befall those who cross your path.
Whenever encountering a place of Great Suffering.
You may relive the tragedy through a memory that
lingers, gain an Omen.
There is a 1/20 chance that things become all too
real. You suffer the same fate in reality. This
might cause Creatures and Magicks to reappear.
PRE -2, STR +0
Persuasion/Negotiation tests only succeed
when rolled below 10.
Spend an Omen to cause a Morale test.
45 Inventive
A tool can serve many functions, It is only right that you are to exploit it.
PRE +3

tspan.tspan: Iron Stomach
When crops fail, and livestock births inedible abominations.
One learns to not be picky when it comes to food.

text.tspan: TOU +2

tspan.tspan: Lucky
Fate? Sounds ominous. You prefer luck. Good things always seem
to happen to you. This has lulled you into a false sense of security.
How long will this last?

text.tspan: 3 abilities equal to 0

tspan.tspan: Masochist
The sensation of stripped flesh and nerve
crackling pain brings your mind complete clarity.

text.tspan: Losing more than half your max HP in a fight
gives you a Extra Action.
Morale tests that are caused by pain are
always successful.
